title: Rotational kinematics - linear speed of coins

content.question: Two coins are on a rotating circular platform of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown. The coins are rotating counterclockwise, without slipping on the platform, at a constant angular speed. Coin <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is at a distance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> from the center of the platform and has a linear speed of <math alttext="v sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. Coin <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is at a distance <math alttext="the fraction R over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> from the center of the platform and has linear speed <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="v sub A to v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></mfrac></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
